title: Member Preview: John Singer Sargent and Chicago’s Gilded Age
hero_caption: The Fountain, Villa Torlonia, Frascati, Italy, John Singer Sargent, 1907
short_description: See the new John Singer Sargent exhibition before it opens to the public
header_description: Members can attend a preview of the John Singer Sargent exhibition before it opens to the public
list_description: Members of the Art Institute of Chicago can see John Singer Sargent and Chicago’s Gilded Age—featuring approximately 100 objects by the beloved artist and others in his circle—before it opens to the public.
description:
Members of the Art Institute of Chicago can see John Singer Sargent and Chicago’s Gilded Age—featuring approximately 100 objects by the beloved artist and others in his circle—before it opens to the public.

The first Art Institute exhibition devoted to the beloved American portraitist explores the connections between Sargent and his patrons, his creative circle, and Chicago.

Sargent became the most sought-after portraitist of his generation on both sides of the Atlantic. Born in Italy to American parents, he traveled the world in search of subjects and worked professionally for more than 50 years creating vibrant, lively paintings.

No registration required - just show your member card.
